GlooKit.GlooFramework

Class Room

  • java.lang.Object
    • GlooKit.GlooFramework.KitBit
      • GlooKit.GlooFramework.Nook
        • GlooKit.GlooFramework.Room

  • public class Room
extends Nook
    Rooms are owned by a GlooApplication and are the visual state of the application. A GlooApplication may only have one GlooApplication at a time, as the previous one will be destroyed when the new one is added. Room extends Nook, which means that Rooms capture user input. Examples of a Room include a MainMenu or a Settings screen.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Nook

    • Constructor Detail

      • Room

        public Room(GlooApplication app,
            KitBit... children)
        Constructs a Room with only the GlooApplication and a list of KitBit which are the children of this Room.
        Parameters:
        app - The GlooApplication which contains this Room and gives the Room user input
        children - possibly many KitBits, which are children of this Room. Can take any number of KitBits (null for none)

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public void configure()
        Initiates the process of telling all visible KitBits by grabbing the spacing and pointSize from the GlooApplication. This calls the recursive configure(float, float), thereby ensuring that all of the descendants of this Room receive the information.
